summary.long: Philemon is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother, to Philemon, our beloved fellow worker,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the beloved Apphia, to Archippus our fellow soldier, and to the assembly in your house:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I thank my God always, making mention of you in my prayers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: hearing of your love and of the faith which you have toward the Lord Jesus and toward all the saints,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the fellowship of your faith may become effective in the knowledge of every good thing which is in us in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we have much joy and comfort in your love, because the hearts of the saints have been refreshed through you, brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore though I have all boldness in Christ to command you that which is appropriate,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet for love’s sake I rather appeal to you, being such a one as Paul, the aged, but also a prisoner of Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I appeal to you for my child Onesimus, whom I have become the father of in my chains,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who once was useless to you, but now is useful to you and to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am sending him back. Therefore receive him, that is, my own heart,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom I desired to keep with me, that on your behalf he might serve me in my chains for the Good News.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I was willing to do nothing without your consent, that your goodness would not be as of necessity, but of free will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For perhaps he was therefore separated from you for a while that you would have him forever,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: no longer as a slave, but more than a slave, a beloved brother—especially to me, but how much rather to you, both in the flesh and in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If then you count me a partner, receive him as you would receive me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he has wronged you at all or owes you anything, put that to my account.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, Paul, write this with my own hand: I will repay it (not to mention to you that you owe to me even your own self besides).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, brother, let me have joy from you in the Lord. Refresh my heart in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Having confidence in your obedience, I write to you, knowing that you will do even beyond what I say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also, prepare a guest room for me, for I hope that through your prayers I will be restored to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, greets you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, my fellow workers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
